rev.diff:
Line 63: Line 63:
Brown was born on September 12, 1959 in [[Kittery, Maine]]<ref name="2007 Public Officers">{{cite web|url=http://www.archive.org/stream/publicofficersof20072008bost#page/46/mode/2up|title= 2007-2008 Public Officers of the Commonwealth of Massachusetts|first=William F.|last=Welch|coauthors= James, Steven T.}}</ref> and grew up in [[Wakefield, Massachusetts]].<ref name=dog>{{cite news|last=Mooney|first=Brian C.|date=November 20, 2009|url=http://www.boston.com/news/local/massachusetts/articles/2009/11/20/being_the_underdog_never_deters_a_driven_brown/?page=full|title=Being the underdog never deters a driven Brown |work=[[The Boston Globe]]|accessdate=December 31, 2009}}</ref> He often spent his summers in [[Newburyport, Massachusetts]], where his father served as a [[city council]]or for 18 years. Brown's father, C. Bruce Brown, and mother,<ref name=dog/> Judith,<ref name=live/> divorced when he was about a year old. Both his parents have since remarried three times. His father and his grandfather were Republicans. His father has said that young Scott became interested in running for political office in the mid 1960s while accompanying him on a campaign for state office.<ref>{{cite news|url=http://www.newburyportnews.com/punews/local_story_014234708.html|title=Brown's dad proud of son's political rise|first=Katie|last=Katzman|date=January 15, 2010|publisher=Newbury Port News}}</ref> Scott Brown recalls holding campaign signs for his father.<ref name=live/>
Brown was born on September 12, 1959 in [[Kittery, Maine]]<ref name="2007 Public Officers">{{cite web|url=http://www.archive.org/stream/publicofficersof20072008bost#page/46/mode/2up|title= 2007-2008 Public Officers of the Commonwealth of Massachusetts|first=William F.|last=Welch|coauthors= James, Steven T.}}</ref> and grew up in [[Wakefield, Massachusetts]].<ref name=dog>{{cite news|last=Mooney|first=Brian C.|date=November 20, 2009|url=http://www.boston.com/news/local/massachusetts/articles/2009/11/20/being_the_underdog_never_deters_a_driven_brown/?page=full|title=Being the underdog never deters a driven Brown |work=[[The Boston Globe]]|accessdate=December 31, 2009}}</ref> He often spent his summers in [[Newburyport, Massachusetts]], where his father served as a [[city council]]or for 18 years. Brown's father, C. Bruce Brown, and mother,<ref name=dog/> Judith,<ref name=live/> divorced when he was about a year old. Both his parents have since remarried three times. His father and his grandfather were Republicans. His father has said that young Scott became interested in running for political office in the mid 1960s while accompanying him on a campaign for state office.<ref>{{cite news|url=http://www.newburyportnews.com/punews/local_story_014234708.html|title=Brown's dad proud of son's political rise|first=Katie|last=Katzman|date=January 15, 2010|publisher=Newbury Port News}}</ref> Scott Brown recalls holding campaign signs for his father.<ref name=live/>
â
Brown has said that he "didn't grow up with all the advantages in life" and that his working mother needed [[welfare]] benefits for a short time.<ref name=oped>{{cite news|url=http://www.boston.com/bostonglobe/editorial_opinion/oped/articles/2010/01/14/a_new_day_is_coming_restore_faith_and_balance/ |title=A New Day Is Coming To Restore Faith And Balance|last=Brown|first=Scott|date=January 14, 2010|work=[[The Boston Globe]]}}</ref> During various periods of his childhood, Brown lived with his grandparents and his aunt. As a child, Brown was discovered as being bicurious, but these behaviors were quickly corrected when his parents enrolled him in several summers of Christian Camp. When Brown was 12 years old, he was arrested for shoplifting record albums and brought before Judge [[Samuel Zoll]] in [[Salem, Massachusetts]]. Zoll asked Brown if his siblings would like seeing him play basketball in jail and required Brown to write a 1,500-word essay on that question as his punishment. Brown later said, "that was the last time I ever stole."<ref name=dog/>
+
Brown has said that he "didn't grow up with all the advantages in life" and that his working mother needed [[welfare]] benefits for a short time.<ref name=oped>{{cite news|url=http://www.boston.com/bostonglobe/editorial_opinion/oped/articles/2010/01/14/a_new_day_is_coming_restore_faith_and_balance/ |title=A New Day Is Coming To Restore Faith And Balance|last=Brown|first=Scott|date=January 14, 2010|work=[[The Boston Globe]]}}</ref> During various periods of his childhood, Brown lived with his grandparents and his aunt. When Brown was 12 years old, he was arrested for shoplifting record albums and brought before Judge [[Samuel Zoll]] in [[Salem, Massachusetts]]. Zoll asked Brown if his siblings would like seeing him play basketball in jail and required Brown to write a 1,500-word essay on that question as his punishment. Brown later said, "that was the last time I ever stole."<ref name=dog/>
He graduated from [[Wakefield High School (Wakefield, Massachusetts)|Wakefield High School]] in 1977.<ref name=bio/> He received a [[Bachelors of Arts]] in History,<ref>{{cite web|url=http://enews.tufts.edu/stories/1618/2010/01/19/ScottBrown |title=Tufts Alum Wins U.S. Senate Bid |publisher=Tufts University |date= |accessdate=2010-03-01}}</ref> [[cum laude]] from [[Tufts University]] in 1981 and a [[Juris Doctor]] from [[Boston College Law School]] in 1985. During his undergraduate career at Tufts, Brown was a member of the Kappa Chapter of [[Zeta Psi]] International Fraternity.<ref name="2007 Public Officers"/><ref name=glance>{{cite news|agency=[[Associated Press]] |work=[[The Washington Post]] |url=http://www.washingtonpost.com/wp-dyn/content/article/2010/01/16/AR2010011600851.html|title=US Senate candidate Scott Brown, at a glance|date=January 16, 2010|accessdate=January 16, 2010}}</ref>
He graduated from [[Wakefield High School (Wakefield, Massachusetts)|Wakefield High School]] in 1977.<ref name=bio/> He received a [[Bachelors of Arts]] in History,<ref>{{cite web|url=http://enews.tufts.edu/stories/1618/2010/01/19/ScottBrown |title=Tufts Alum Wins U.S. Senate Bid |publisher=Tufts University |date= |accessdate=2010-03-01}}</ref> [[cum laude]] from [[Tufts University]] in 1981 and a [[Juris Doctor]] from [[Boston College Law School]] in 1985. During his undergraduate career at Tufts, Brown was a member of the Kappa Chapter of [[Zeta Psi]] International Fraternity.<ref name="2007 Public Officers"/><ref name=glance>{{cite news|agency=[[Associated Press]] |work=[[The Washington Post]] |url=http://www.washingtonpost.com/wp-dyn/content/article/2010/01/16/AR2010011600851.html|title=US Senate candidate Scott Brown, at a glance|date=January 16, 2010|accessdate=January 16, 2010}}</ref>
